text.text: How do I itemize supplies in ZOLL Billing?

text: To itemize supplies in ZOLL Billing, you can click the Charges tab and check the View field to verify that you are on the right charge category. If you are, click Itemize supplies. A pop-up window will display.

text.text: What types of supplies can be itemized in ZOLL Billing?

text:
The following types of supplies can be itemized in ZOLL Billing:

* Drugs
* Medical devices
* Laboratory tests
* Office supplies
* Travel expenses

text.text: Can you explain the process of adding an itemized charge for supplies?

text: To add an itemized charge for supplies, you can click Settings on the navigation bar and then click the Charges tab. You can then check the View field and verify that you are on the right charge category. If you are, click Itemize supplies. A pop-up window will display.

text.text: What do payers receive regarding itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text: After you create the itemized list, you can add the supplies to your claim. ZOLL Billing will sum the cost of the used supplies and send payers the total as a single HCPCS. If a payer needs to justify the amount, you can print the "Print Charge Details" report from the Claim page and send it to the payer.

text.text: How are itemized charges displayed on patient invoices?

text: The patient invoice will breakout every supply item used and list them on the invoice.

text.text: What is the purpose of adding an unlisted ambulance services charge?

text: Itemizing is the practice of taking supplies used during transport and billing a patient or payer for each supply used.

text.text: Could you guide me through the process of adding an unlisted ambulance services charge?

text: Sure, here are the steps on how to add an unlisted ambulance services charge: 1. Click Settings on the navigation bar 2. Click the Charges tab 3. Check the View field and verify that you are on the right charge category 4. Click Itemize supplies.

text.text: When adding a new charge for unlisted ambulance services, what information do I need to provide?

text: When adding a new charge for unlisted ambulance services, you need to provide the following information: Supply type, Price per unit, and Units.

text.text: How can I bill an A0999 charge to the patient only in ZOLL Billing?

text: To bill an A0999 charge to the patient only, you can click the Charges tab and find the A0999 charge. Click the edit icon next to that charge. In the window that opens, click the circle next to Patient only and then click Save.

text.text: What steps are involved in billing an A0999 charge exclusively to the patient?

text: To bill an A0999 charge to the patient only, you can click the Charges tab and find the A0999 charge. Click the edit icon next to that charge. In the window that opens, click the circle next to Patient only and then click Save. Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: Is it possible to modify an A0999 charge to bill it only to the patient?

text: Yes, you can modify an A0999 charge to bill it only to the patient.

text.text: What does the "Patient only" option signify for an A0999 charge?

text: The "Patient only" option for an A0999 charge means that the charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: Can you describe the significance of the "Price per unit" field when adding an itemized charge?

text: The price per unit is the amount that will display on any claim with that charge type (HCPCS). The system records the charge amounts you enter, so that price per unit will display from that time forward on any claim with that charge type.

text.text: How do I save changes made to itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text: To save changes made to itemized charges in ZOLL Billing, you can click the Save button at the bottom of the page.

text.text: Where can I find the charges tab to manage itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text: To get to the Charges tab, you can click Settings on the navigation bar.

text.text: how to add itemized charge? explain in detail

text: To add an itemized charge, you can follow these steps: 1. Click Settings on the navigation bar. 2. Click the Charges tab. 3. Click the Itemize supplies link at the top of the page.

text.text: explain itemized supplies

text: Itemized supplies are supplies that are billed individually, rather than as a group. The decision to itemize your supplies is something your company decides to do. After you create the itemized list, you can add the supplies to your claim. ZOLL Billing will sum the cost of the used supplies and send payers the total as a single HCPCS. If a payer needs to justify the amount, you can print the "Print Charge Details" report from the Claim page and send it to the payer.

After you create the itemized list, you can add the supplies to your claim. ZOLL Billing will sum the cost of the used supplies and send payers the total as a single HCPCS. If a payer needs to justify the amount, you can print the "Print Charge Details" report from the Claim page and send it to the payer.

text.text: how to bill an a0999 charge to the patient only?

text: To bill an A0999 charge to the patient only, you can follow these steps: 1. Click the Charges tab and find the A0999 charge. 2. Click the edit icon next to that charge. 3. In the window that opens, click the circle next to Patient only and then click Save. Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: How to billing a patient for itemized charges?

text: Itemizing is the practice of taking supplies used during transport and billing a patient or payer for each supply used. In order to do this, the supplies must be associated with a billable HCPCS. You can bill for itemized ALS and BLS Routine Disposable Supplies (A0382 and A0398), ALS and BLS Defibrillation Supplies (A0384 and A0392), Esophageal Intubation Supplies (A0396) and IV Drug Therapy Supplies (A0394).
